headline: Yummy Yam Casserole
description: I call this the 'recipe with legs' because every time I serve it, the recipe is requested. Even those who dislike yams and sweet potatoes love this tasty dish! This dish can be frozen, but freeze it without the pecan topping. Defrost before baking.

video.description: This casserole is creamy and crunchy, and not too sweet.
video.name: Yummy Yam Casserole

name: Yummy Yam Casserole

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Poke yams in several places with a fork, then cook them on high power in microwave oven until heated through and soft, about 20 minutes. When cooled, remove skins and place the yams in a large bowl.

Beat yams until smooth. Then beat in one egg at a time, blending after each addition. Stir in 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1/8 cup melted butter, salt, cinnamon, allspice and nutmeg; beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Transfer mixture to an ungreased 3 quart casserole dish. Arrange the pecans in a single layer on top. Sprinkle with remaining brown sugar and drizzle 1/4 cup melted butter over the top.
Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until browned and bubbly.

review.reviewBody: Rave reviews! I roasted my yams for an hour at 400 and mixed the pecans and melted butter together before I topped the yams. Perfect!

I followed this recipe with exception of baking the yams instead of using the microwave. I also made certain that after baking and peeling the skins off I re-weighed my yams to make certain I had the full 4lbs for the recipe. This made a hugh difference from my first time it filled the 3 quart oblong casserole dish like the video before I added the topping. Yummy??perfecto!!

I don’t like yams but my dad insisted we buy two for Thanksgiving dinner. He suggested just roasting them in the oven but I wanted to try to find I way I might enjoy them and I found this recipe. I made two substitutions so my vegan husband could try also: flaxseed egg in place of the egg and coconut oil in place of the butter. It was really tasty and I would definitely make it again.
Loved this! Microwaving the yams worked great! Instead of the brown sugar, flour and butter topping, I did a generous drizzle of Bourbon infused maple syrup over the pecans. Delicious!
Delicious!!
This has become a holiday staple for the last 3 years.
It was easy enough and amazing as others have said. It was wonderful because it was not too sweet like candied yams. most everyone didn't think any sugar was added which is a plus for this group.
Made it as written - big hit for family Christmas dinner.

It turned out fantastic because I accidentally only used half the amount of yams. Even the non-yam lovers raved about it.
I chopped the pecans and toasted in butter before adding.

This is a keeper. Next time I won't use quite as many pecans, probably 4 oz. I also didn't whip the yams for a long time, just enough to mix them. I may try them in chunks next time. The brown sugar and butter caramelize the pecans on top and they make this casserole yummy. I simply put this in my 325 degree oven by the turkey for about 45 minutes and it came out great.

This is similar to my grandmother's recipe. I always add a layer of miniature marshmallows on top of the sweet potato mixture, then mix the butter, brown sugar, etc together for the topping and drizzle it across the top of the marshmallows. Family favorite for three generations!

Absolutely a hit at our pre thanksgiving dinner. Like the Lizalouise said- it is the recipe with legs as I have to foward this recipe to two of my dinner guests. One thing I did add to the recipe were mini marshmellows on top. Delicious!!!
I made it, and it was delicious! I didn't change a thing. I already have a request for this recipe from one of those who joined us for Thanksgiving last year.
There's WAY too much sugar in this recipe. I doubt I'll make it again, even with less sugar.
I’m not a fan of yams or sweet potatoes but have made this for thanksgiving and Christmas and everyone raved about it. So, it’s a keeper, I guess!
Wonderful! Substituted pure maple syrup for sugar. Awesome’
Everyone loved it. It was a hit.
Family loved this recipe. Marshmallows added and toasted around outer edge as final step.

This was delicious! Instead of fresh sweet potatoes, I took the easy way out and used Bruce’s canned yams (2). In addition, I used 1/4 cup of sugar in the potatoes instead of 1/2. Everyone loved them! I will definitely make this again!
Easy and delicious!
I made this one, but added mini-marshmallows in addition to the pecans. It was the hit of of our Thanksgiving dinner!! YUMMY is right!!

Thought I try something different from my usual candied yam dish. I gave this one a try and was not impressed! I think that this really needs a crumb topping to avoid cheweing on the brown sugar topping!

Made this recipe last year for Thanksgiving (and Christmas) and it was a hit even with people who don't normally like yams. It is easy to prepare and store ahead of time but, more importantly, it tastes delicious. My niece told me it was better than candy :)

I have made this recipe multiple times with zero changes,which for me is rare, but this recipe is absolute perfection just the way it is. Every time I make this it gets devoured and I have multiple people asking for the recipe. I'd give this more stars if I could ??
Everyone asks for this recipe when I make it. It’s part of my thanksgiving rotation now
Sprinkle some mini marshmallows too
I've been making this recipe for about fifteen years. I REALLY love it. I add a smidge more spices and sometimes mix crushed pecans into the sweet potato, but otherwise follow the directions.

Yes, I am a yam fan and made it for Thanksgiving. Easy to make a day ahead. I cooked it without the pecans and refrigerated it overnight according to a helpful review. I added the pecans the next day when I reheated the casserole and they caramelized.
Very yummy indeed!

This is super easy and super yummy. I made some short cuts and adjustments. I wanted to make a double batch for Thanksgiving. I used three large cans of perpaered yams. I doubled all of the ingredients, BUT not the brown sugar. To make the dish a little more health conscious I used 1 and 1/2 of the prown sugar and the same with the butter. Noone even noticed the difference from when i made this last year as a single batch with the full meause of sugar and butter. 
It is delicious! either way.

Love, love this recipe. This is always on the Thanksgiving menu. I have made as written and loved it. However, my kids don't like pecans. So I make it with marshmallows instead. I just omit the extra brown sugar and butter. Personally I prefer the pecans but the kids win for now. I never have left overs
Great recipe, easy, great flavour......a winner !!!
I made it for a party and everybody loved it!
This was great. I didn't! Change anything.
This is now my favorite yam recipe for Thanksgiving. The topping of pecans makes it a beautidul dish to share with guests. Favors are wonderful.

I loved this. Didn't change a thing. I love that you can make it the day ahead, without the toppings and then just add them and pop it in the oven while the turkey is resting. I've also frozen it uncooked without toppings a week ahead of time, thawed it in the fridge, and then done the same thing. It's a great recipe. It looks really pretty too! My family gave it great reviews!
I made this for thanksgiving and my family loved it.
Yes i will make it again
I liked this, but made about 2x the topping because that was the best part. It's sort of an intermediate between savoury and dessert, which I find odd, but on the whole pretty good.
Next time I would add half of the cinnamon called for in the recipe
Made for Thanksgiving and had a double batch requested for Christmas. This was a huge hit.

I made this for my husband specifically for Thanksgiving. I was looking for a grown up "candied yam" recipe that my family would enjoy. I am not a fan of sweet potatoes or yams, and I did not expect to like this. It was actually my favorite dish on Thanksgiving. It is going to be a Thanksgiving staple from now on. I used a food processor to "mash" the sweet potatoes. And I used Mrs Dash, instead of salt. :)
Super easy! Super yummy! Friendsgiving party hit!

I added more cinnamon and about a cup of buttermilk and a cup of sugar to the yams. The mixture seemed to be a little dry for me and not sweet enough. I then put a layer of cream cheese filling on top of yams- one 8 ounce package of cream cheese melted, 1/4 cup of butter, one egg yolk, 1 tsp. of vanilla extract, and 3/4 cup of powdered sugar. For the topping I doubled the recipe because I like lots of pecans and added 1/4 cup of flour. Yum Yum!!
My husband cooked this for Thanks Giving and it was delicious!
Everybody loved it>

I made this for a Christmas luncheon and received raves! I made the potatoes the day before, refrigerated and baked with the topping the next day. I didn't vary the recipe at all. Absolutely scrumptious!
Made this for Thanksgiving and every one enjoyed it. Will make it again. Easy and fast with lots of favor.
This tasted like pumpkin pie filling. lol... I topped half with mini marshmallows and the other half with the pecans. I liked the pecan side better. This was super yummy.

The recipe was delicious, but microwaving the yams was a pain. The yams cooked unevenly. Next time, I will peel the yams ahead of time and then boil them to cook them. I had to boil the ones that did not get cooked all of the way through!
I have made this one for years and my husband goes crazy for it! The only thing I do differently is I add pineapple chuncks to the mixture. So yummy!!

If you're looking for a yam recipe... You can stop now because you found it! Everyone loved this when I made this last year for a family dinner... Even me and I don't like yams. My mother insisted we add yams to the menu so I obliged and went searching for a recipe and found this one. Thank you for sharing this and thank God I found it again (forgot to tag it) will be adding it to the Thanksgiving menu this year!

I saw this recipe a few years ago looking for something diffrent for Thanksgiving. My family is not much into yams but I figured Id give it a shot. I and the whole fam bam loved it. I make it every year and sometime just be cause it's so good.
I added the marshmallows as topping! Turned out very good! Will definitely make this dish again!
Very tasty. I used chopped pecans to make it easier to serve and eat.
My family loved this recipe! I will be using this recipe every Thanksgiving.

The pecans are a really nice touch, and they add some crunch. I don't think it needs all that sugar, though - it's too sweet for me. Pile on the butter and it's all good.

You can just boil the yams on a stove if you have microwave like me.

Fantastic, I made it for thanksgiving this year and everyone loved it. I baked my yams instead of cooking them in the microwave, and I put the pecans through the food processor for a quick pulse instead of putting them on whole, but otherwise I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out fantastic. Really, really good.
Excellent!
Made this for my 3 year old and my wife and I practically ate the whole thing ourselves. The only thing is that I skipped the pecans but it came out perfect.
Followed the recipe exactly and it turned out perfectly. This is my new go-to candied yams recipe.

Great recipe as written. Even people who don't like yams or sweet potatoes love this, ask for more and ask for the recipe. I have made it ahead of time (up to the point of adding the stuff to the top) and froze it until the day I needed it. Then just allow to thaw, add the stuff to the top and bake.

Amazing compliment to my turkey dinner. I wrapped the yams in tinfoil and popped them in the oven next to the turkey to bake, and took them out after about 1-1/2 hours. Let them cool, then removed the skins, and prepped the casserole. I used my electric mixer to whip them into a super creamy texture. Once my turkey was cooked, I removed it from the oven and then put the casserole in to bake while I made my gravy and carved the bird. The timing was perfect.

i doubled the recipe due to cooking for alot of people but it was ruined becuase of one thing , the all spice , whoever wrote this recipe down either miscopied or was drunk cuz the allspice just ruined the dinner way to over powering next time i'll use half what it calls for with the allspice , other than that i think it was good although i have to cook it again too get a better taste of this great dish

I make this every year for Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter. It is so delicious and my family loves it! I buy pecans in bulk and just use enough to cover the entire top of the casserole to make it look really pretty.
I make this every year at Thanksgiving and Christmas ans it is always a crowd pleaser!!
Very tasty. Decided to add vanilla extract, orange zest and almond extract too. Definite keeper. Thanks for the recipe!

I never liked yams--wouldn't touch'em with a ten foot pole. Several years ago, I was asked to bring a side dish for Thankgiving and my usual dishes were already "taken" by other cooks. So I read these reviews and decided to give it a try. This is soooooo good I could not believe it. My dad who shared my dislike of yams tried and loved it as well. This recipe has become a part of our holiday "regulars" since.
Yep, it was a winning recipe at our Thanksgiving table. Made the recipe exactly as written. I preferred the pecans to be crushed into smaller pieces. Thanks for sharing!

so year after year I tried different recipes for holidays with yams... never got the family to eat any until I brought this one, have thrown the rest out and use this one... everyone loves it and eats every bit. YEA>>>>
This is my 2nd year making this and this is the only way my family will eat yams. I do make one change - I am allergic to nutmeg and pecans so basically use just cinnamon for the spice. Delicious!
This is my 2nd year making this and this is the only way my family will eat yams. I do make one change - I am allergic to nutmeg and pecans so basically use just cinnamon for the spice. Delicious!

This recipe was delicious, you do not need a blender if you have a strong mixing arm. I froze half of it and am looking forward to another dish. I do not like how much butter it calls for but it tastes so good.
Chopped the pecans and added mini marshmallows on top of casserole. Wow! Family ate it up and wanted more. :)
Perfect.

Very good. I don't usually make anything with sweet potatoes (easily confused with yams in the U.S.) but was given several and decided to search for a good recipe. I saw the reviews for this one and made it-I like it. I also like that it can be frozen.

What an easy and delicious casserole! I followed the directions a written and it came out a winner! I received many complements and had no left-overs. Thanks for posting such an easy and tasty recipe!

I have made this for Thanksgiving for the past several years for my family. Everyone in my family LOVES this dish, including the picky eaters! We were never big yam/sweet potato fans before this, but now everyone requests that this dish be served every Thanksgiving- this recipe will be included in our family cookbook! The only thing I changed about the recipe is that I use canned yams, because its a time saver. Other than that, this recipe is perfect!

This was very good. I must admit, I used some frozen sweet potatoes instead of fresh yams. Regardless, it was wonderful! My brother remarked that it tasted more like a dessert than a side, but it wasn't too rich or sweet. I bet if I put this in a pie crust, people would eat it like a pumpkin pie. I might have to try that sometime.
This was a hit for Thanksgiving dinner - disappeared in 5 minutes.
This dish made a believer out of all those folks who thought they hated sweet potatoes/yams!!! I roasted my yams in the oven first and then made the recipe just as written! Fantastic!!
thanks for sharing have been making this for a few years now and have to agree with angelkaren's review : )
Taste like pumpkin pie
Good for people who don't like yams, not for those who do.

Wow Excellent. Family members who have always "hated" sweet potatoes went back for seconds. I even heard the comment do we have to wait for Christmas to have it again?
Thank you for sharing what will become a family classic
Quite sweet - tastes a bit like pumpkin pie. It was the first time all my kids love eating yams.
Amazing, this is the only Yam/Sweet Potato casserole I have ever liked. Everyone in my family liked it so much they asked for the recipe. I think if you put it in a crust you could call it pie.
OMG - this was the most favorite part of the CHristmas dinner at my house, as voted by the ten people at the table. It was unanimous. You can't miss with this one. Really really good!
Excellent recipe, everyone who ate it, loved it.
2 BIG thumbs up!

This recipe is simple to make and tastes fantastic, I will make this again. Everyone loved it. Thanks for sharing. I didn't have nutmeg or allspice so I used 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice and it worked great.
Good, but nothing GREAT! I like the pecans on top and I did decrease the butter!
love this recipe! tried another recipe on this site but this one is definitely better! and so easy!
I added fresh minced ginger. Great!

Yummy Yam Casserole is right! Made it exactly as written and it was great, a great addition to our Thanksgiving table. On Sunday, this morning, I made pumpkin bread but used the left over casserole instead of pumpkin puree, that tasted great too.
My family loved this!

Oh, so much better than the old standbys with miniature marshmallows. I drained a big can of yams and beat with the electric mixer, then made as directed. I made this the day before without the topping, then added the pecans, brown sugar, and melted butter to the top and stuck it in the oven while the dressing baked. It was perfect. I can't say my guests raved about it, since only two of us eat yams, but if you love yams or sweet potatoes, you should love this.

Yams just roasted in the oven with a bit of olive oil is wonderful, but this casserole dish is perfect for Thanksgiving! Everyone loves it... even those who do not like yams/sweet potatoes! It's a must at our Thanksgiving meal!
I made this for our canadian thanksgiving on October 8, 2010 and it is delicious. I will be making this again as my family has now requested that I make it for special family dinners.

I made this recipe for Thanksgiving and it was a hit with most people. I, personally, found it a bit too sweet... even after taking 1/2 cup of sugar out. But definitely a good veggie dish for non-veggie people.
